conclusion: Determine the amount of heat exchanged over one complete cycle ABCDA.
AB is an isochoric process with constant volume V1 and pressure increases from p1 to p2.
BC is an isobaric process with constant pressure p2 and volume increases from V1 to V2.
CD is an isochoric process with constant volume V2 and pressure decreases from p2 to p1.
DA is an isobaric process with constant pressure p1 and volume decreases from V2 to V1.
In isochoric process AB, no work is done: W_AB = 0.
In isobaric process BC, work done is W_BC = p2(V2 - V1).
In isochoric process CD, no work is done: W_CD = 0.
In isobaric process DA, work done is W_DA = p1(V1 - V2).
Total work done over the cycle is W_total = (p2 - p1)(V2 - V1).
For a cyclic process, net change in internal energy is zero: Î”U = 0.
Using the first law of thermodynamics, Q = W.
Amount of heat exchanged is Q = (p2 - p1)(V2 - V1).
